definition: to reincarnate/reincarnation (Buddhism)/(of the seasons etc) to follow each other cyclically/cycle/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 輪迴|轮回[lun2 hui2]
wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

sentences.english: By putting the seven great nails on the narrow paths of samsara and nirvana.
sentences.chinese: 将七根大钉钉于轮回与涅盘之狭路上。

sentences.english: This fame have a metempsychosis again.
sentences.chinese: 传说在花江峡谷开始了又一次轮回。

Does not lost hope loves also, after the samsara, again.
sentences.chinese: 心不死爱还在，轮回后重新再来。

sentences.english: Our actions keeps us bound to the continuous cycle of worldly existence, to the endless round of birth and death.
sentences.chinese: 我们的行为把我们系缚在不断循环的生死轮回之中。

sentences.english: But the world has become a repeated dust, the dust has settled that moment, Jesus Christ reincarnation.

sentences.english: Nature includes four new filters and reincarnates six Eye Candy classics.

sentences.english: Dreams, cycle of three thousand years, at the world stage.
sentences.chinese: 魂牵梦萦，三千年的轮回，于今世上演。

sentences.english: It is the situation that we can't select freely, which seems to be the essence of metempsychosis .
sentences.chinese: 这种无法自由选择的情况，似乎就是轮回的本质。

sentences.english: Red and white choice, and choice of endless waiting for reincarnation.

sentences.english: Chosen, eaten, and turned into the Next Big Thing.
sentences.chinese: 选中，吃下，然后进入下一次大轮回。

sentences.english: 'It's a rotation within Asia, ' said Bank of America-Merrill Lynch's Mr. Sinha.
sentences.chinese: 美银美林的辛哈说，这是亚洲内部的资金轮回。

sentences.english: Let the second hand suspend, awakes from the samsara, loves thorough.

definition: this life/to lose face/to be disgraced
variable/changeable/fickle/impermanence (Sanskrit: anitya)/ghost taking away the soul after death/to pass away/to die
time and place/world of a particular locale and era/(physics) space-time
to stand aloof/to be detached from/to transcend worldliness/untrammeled/unconventional
eternal/everlasting/fig. to pass into eternity (i.e. to die)
